newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Astra says US Losec sales up 28 pct in H1.
newsitem.headline: Astra says US Losec sales up 28 pct in H1.

text.p: Swedish drugs company Astra said on Thursday that sales of its anti-ulcer drug Losec in the U.S. rose 28 percent to $1.02 billion in the first half of 1997.
Astra said in a statement that the growth in total prescriptions during the six months was about 30 percent.
In the second quarter sales of Losec, which is sold as Prilosec in the U.S., amounted to $500 million which was an increase of 33 percent on the same period a year earlier.
Losec is sold as Prilosec in the U.S. through Astra Merck Inc., which is owned equally by Astra and the U.S. drugs group Merck & Co.
Sales of Plendil through Astra Merck in the first half of 1997 amounted to $55 million compared to $45 million a year earlier.
Astra shares fell on news of the Losec sales, and at 1200 GMT were trading five crowns lower at 152 crowns.
